events.body:
Just saying, I am going to submit a pull for adding a new dynamic column to the transactions-list. That way you can filter and sort by watch-only. In the overviewpage, I just wrote watch-only before the address, that way its a little easier to grasp.
The blue color may make the watch-only txs look more important than the normal ones.
What do you think?

![watchonly_column1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2814559/3868427/79e2ba42-2041-11e4-822f-766e15726ebf.png)

![watchonly_column2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2814559/3868428/7fdc5fd4-2041-11e4-8ea3-fb0a1fe0e7b6.png)

![watchonly_column](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2814559/3868429/85087182-2041-11e4-9220-b09972479a00.png)

@cozz I just chose blueish, because I thought watch-only should visually be different. By adding a new column this is also achieved :). But I think for adresses with and without label (watch-only) should be appended, not prepended (on the overviewpage as in tooltips). Otherwise I like your solution better.
I missed this one somehow. Does #4673 include all the changes here?

@laanwj I'm going to remove the watch-only stuff from this, so it can be merged.

Updated!

rename.from: [Qt] some cleanup and watch-only changes to transactiontablemodel

events.message:
[Qt] add all used colors in txtablemodel to guiconstants

- add colors used in TX status decoration

[Qt] simplify return code and return values in txtablemodel

- also move an added space in a string where it belongs

events.body: @laanwj Should be ready now, can you take a look?

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4667_bbad683224c77743a9fef5cc2fc64cc43fbec192/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
@diapolo eh, closed, what about the other changes?
Uuups, that was not intentionally... re-opened.
@laanwj If you want, you can merge this now.
@laanwj Ping, can we please get this merged after your ACK :)?

comments.body: @laanwj I guess this could just `return QVariant();` and I could remove `COLOR_BLACK`?

Please keep these here. The reason is to keep all compile-time configurability of the GUI in one place.
At some point these may be run-time configurable, but NACK on just moving them to another header.
@laanwj Ping, can I use the above suggestion here?

Oh, I missed this somehow!
What would be the result of that? I think my original reason for putting COLOR_BLACK here is that otherwise it would look very strange if it ever ends up here (which can happen during development when statusses are added)
I let it stay black, thanks for clarifying :).
